verses.kjv: The word of the LORD that came to Micah the Morasthite in the days of Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah, which he saw concerning Samaria and Jerusalem.
verses.ct: This is the message from the LORD that came to Micah of Moresheth during the reigns of Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah — what he saw in vision regarding Samaria and Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: Hear, all ye people; hearken, O earth, and all that therein is: and let the Lord GOD be witness against you, the LORD from his holy temple.
verses.ct: Listen, all you nations! Pay attention, earth and everyone on it! Let the Lord GOD testify against you, the LORD from his holy temple.

verses.kjv: For, behold, the LORD cometh forth out of his place, and will come down, and tread upon the high places of the earth.
verses.ct: Look — the LORD is coming out from his dwelling place. He will come down and march across the heights of the earth.

verses.kjv: And the mountains shall be molten under him, and the valleys shall be cleft, as wax before the fire, and as the waters that are poured down a steep place.
verses.ct: The mountains will melt beneath him, and the valleys will split apart — like wax in front of a flame, like water rushing down a hillside.

verses.kjv: For the transgression of Jacob is all this, and for the sins of the house of Israel. What is the transgression of Jacob? is it not Samaria? and what are the high places of Judah? are they not Jerusalem?
verses.ct: All of this is because of Jacob's rebellion and the sins of the nation of Israel. What caused Jacob's rebellion? Wasn't it Samaria? And what are Judah's places of false worship? Aren't they in Jerusalem?

verses.kjv: Therefore I will make Samaria as an heap of the field, and as plantings of a vineyard: and I will pour down the stones thereof into the valley, and I will discover the foundations thereof.
verses.ct: "So I will turn Samaria into a pile of rubble in an open field, a place for planting vineyards. I will send its stones tumbling into the valley and expose its foundations."

verses.kjv: And all the graven images thereof shall be beaten to pieces, and all the hires thereof shall be burned with the fire, and all the idols thereof will I lay desolate: for she gathered it of the hire of an harlot, and they shall return to the hire of an harlot.
verses.ct: All its carved idols will be smashed to pieces, all its temple earnings will be consumed by fire, and all its false gods I will leave in ruins. Since she accumulated her wealth through prostitution, it will be carried off and spent on prostitution again.

verses.kjv: Therefore I will wail and howl, I will go stripped and naked: I will make a wailing like the dragons, and mourning as the owls.
verses.ct: Because of this, I will weep and cry out. I will walk around barefoot and stripped. I will wail like jackals and moan like ostriches.

verses.kjv: For her wound is incurable; for it is come unto Judah; he is come unto the gate of my people, even to Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Her wound cannot be healed, and it has spread all the way to Judah. It has reached the very gates of my people, right up to Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: Declare ye it not at Gath, weep ye not at all: in the house of Aphrah roll thyself in the dust.
verses.ct: Don't announce it in Gath; don't weep there at all. In Beth-le-aphrah, roll in the dust.

verses.kjv: Pass ye away, thou inhabitant of Saphir, having thy shame naked: the inhabitant of Zaanan came not forth in the mourning of Bethezel; he shall receive of you his standing.
verses.ct: Pass on your way, people of Saphir, stripped and humiliated. The people of Zaanan don't dare come out. Beth-ezel is mourning, and its support is taken from you.

verses.kjv: For the inhabitant of Maroth waited carefully for good: but evil came down from the LORD unto the gate of Jerusalem.
verses.ct: The people of Maroth anxiously waited for relief, but disaster came down from the LORD to the gates of Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: O thou inhabitant of Lachish, bind the chariot to the swift beast: she is the beginning of the sin to the daughter of Zion: for the transgressions of Israel were found in thee.
verses.ct: People of Lachish, harness your fastest horses to the chariots! You were the starting point of sin for the people of Zion, because Israel's rebellions were found in you.

verses.kjv: Therefore shalt thou give presents to Moreshethgath: the houses of Achzib shall be a lie to the kings of Israel.
verses.ct: Therefore you will send parting gifts to Moresheth-gath. The town of Achzib will prove to be a disappointment to the kings of Israel.

verses.kjv: Yet will I bring an heir unto thee, O inhabitant of Mareshah: he shall come unto Adullam the glory of Israel.
verses.ct: I will still bring a conqueror against you, people of Mareshah. The glory of Israel will retreat all the way to Adullam.

verses.kjv: Make thee bald, and poll thee for thy delicate children; enlarge thy baldness as the eagle; for they are gone into captivity from thee.
verses.ct: Shave your heads and cut off your hair in grief for the children you love, because they have been taken away from you into exile. Make yourselves as bald as a vulture.
